etymology.description: 词(word; term) + 源(source; origin) = etymology.
etymology.interpretation: Denotes the origin and historical development of a word or term, often used in linguistic discussion. Emphasizes tracing how a lexical item came to be and changed over time.
etymology.simplification: 詞 was simplified to 词 by replacing 言 with the shorthand radical 讠; 源 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 这本词典附有词源说明(這本詞典附有詞源說明)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn cídiǎn fùyǒu cíyuán shuōmíng.

examples.chinese: 他对汉字的词源很感兴趣(他對漢字的詞源很感興趣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì Hànzì de cíyuán hěn gǎn xìngqù.
examples.english: He is very interested in the etymology of Chinese characters.

examples.chinese: “咖啡”一词的词源可追溯到阿拉伯语(「咖啡」一詞的詞源可追溯到阿拉伯語)。
examples.pinyin: “Kāfēi” yī cí de cíyuán kě zhuīsù dào Ālābóyǔ.
examples.english: The etymology of the word “coffee” can be traced back to Arabic.
